channel.title: Help Plz!
channel.description: My server has recently getting flooded with names like 345345, 435345435, 34534532. I was wondering if anyone has the code to stop my server from being flooded by this program. I also have teamviewer.

item.title: Help Plz!
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public int kickTimer = 0;
public void badNames() {
    if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") 
        || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") 
        || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("owner") || playerName.contains("Admin") || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{") 
        || playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("__") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("____") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains("SYI")
        || playerName.contains("SYIpkpker") || playerName.contains("null") || playerName.contains("fuck") || playerName.contains("bitch")) {
        if(kickTimer == 0) {
            sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
            if(checkbannedusers() != 5) {
                disconnected = true; 
                appendToBanned(playerName);
                checkbannedusers();
            }
            kickTimer = 20;
        }
    }   
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help Plz!
item.dc:creator: @Q_Golden_Q Q Golden Q
item.description:
@Q_Golden_Q wrote:

My server also has a built in “protection” class that makes it so people cant log in with more than 5 players from the same ip address but that clearly doesn’t work.

Heres the code for that I don’t if there is anything wrong with it.

[code] /**
* Checks if the Player’s host exceeds the maximum
* amount of connections per host and, if exceeded,
* IP-ban the player’s host.
*
* @param p The player to check.
*/
public static void checkHost(Player p) {
if (p == null) {
return;
}

    String cHost = getHost(p);
    int cCount = 0;

    for (Player o : Engine.players) {
        if (o != null) {
            if (getHost(o).equals(cHost)) {
                cCount++;
            }
        }
    }

    if (cCount >= MAX_CONNECTIONS && cHost.length() > 0) {
        sendLog("Too much connections: " + cHost + " (" + cCount + " connections)");
        killByHost(cHost);
    }
}[/code]

It looks right to me.

So my idea is to make a class which doesn’t allow players to have names that have the first 2 digits as numbers.

Read full topic
